comments:
I have a working 3.1.2 eclipse, which has various 3rd party plugins installed, namely jalopy source formatter, PMD & checkstyle.  I wanted to try 3.2 with these plugins, so once I backed evreything up, I unzipped the 3.2RC7 over the top of the 3.1.2 image (probably not the smartest move I know - but hey I am a developer I do strange things)

Anyway, 3.2 starts okay and my workspace is displayed.  I modify a file and try to save it and I get an error box (sorry no snapshot).  The eclipse log file shows it had an "java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.HistoryStore2.<init>(Lorg/eclipse/core/internal/resources/Workspace;Lorg/eclipse/core/runtime/IPath;I)V" error.  


The log file for the sessions is:


!SESSION 2006-06-09 16:20:57.351 -----------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=I20060602-1317
java.version=1.5.0_06
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.

We offer no support for someone installing a new Eclipse by unzipping on top of an old one.  This can cause all kinds of problems.  See the "Upgrading Eclipse" section of the readme file (eclipse/readme/readme_eclipse.html).
